1. The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
   A classic and inspiring drama about the power of friendship and hope in even the darkest of circumstances.

2. Fight Club (1999)
   A bold and thought-provoking drama about the disillusionment and anger felt by many modern men.
   
3. The Silence of the Lambs (1991)
   A classic and suspenseful drama about the hunt for a serial killer who has taken two young girls hostage in his home.
   
4. Basic Instincts (1992)
   A bold and thought-provoking drama about the exploration of female sexuality and its potential impact on individuals and society as a whole.
   
5. The Talisman (1986)
   An atmospheric and suspenseful drama about the search for a lost talisman, believed to have the power to grant eternal life.

I hope you find these recommendations interesting and helpful. Please feel free to ask any questions or provide further feedback if you wish.

Through their honest conversations about their feelings and desires, Andrew and Claire manage to find common ground and work through their conflicts in a constructive and respectful manner.

Overall, both "The Shawshank Redemption" (1994) and "Marriage Story" (2019) are great films that offer compelling storytelling, well-developed characters, and an overall cinematic experience that is both entertaining and thought-provoking.
